column3: Compiled successfully on all three platforms: https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/pulls/8238/\n
@achow101 Given you opened #7943, are you able to download one of @jonasschnelli's test binaries and try using ZMQ ?\n
@fanquake looks like it works on windows now.\n

Concept ACK. I'd prefer going a slightly different route, though.

Upstream removed the mingw requirement here: https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/commit/9114d3957725acd34aa8b8d011585812f3369411 and a fixup here: https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/commit/9e6745c12e0b100cd38acecc16ce7db02905e27c .

I'd prefer to take those patches directly. Then we can simply drop the patches when we update to a re

@fanquake Please have a look at https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/a8d5faacf5b193cb3468df24ab568f59dab282bb . That takes the upstream commits, as well as disabling curve, which was necessary for me locally.\n
Can someone on Windows @achow101, retest this?\n
